title: Website Schemes
summary: Four narrative schemes for presenting capability-first services with clear story arcs, CTA patterns, and risks.

sections.title: Choose one primary narrative
sections.body: Select the scheme that matches your buyer context, then keep the story consistent across hero, proof, and CTA.

items.name: Problem/Solution
items.whenToUse: Use when buyers feel daily friction and need a practical path out.

hero.headline: Reduce system dependency without replatform chaos.
hero.subhead: Replace reconciliation work with governed execution over your existing systems.

items.risk: Message can sound overly negative if pain is overemphasized.
items.mitigation: Balance every pain statement with a concrete improvement path.

items.name: Aspirational
items.whenToUse: Use when leadership is growth-focused and already aligned on change.
narrativeArc: Paint a clear future operating state.
Show how to start with controlled scope.

hero.headline: Build execution systems that scale with your strategy.
hero.subhead: Move faster with internal control of workflows, data logic, and approval paths.

items.risk: Can feel abstract if not tied to current constraints.
items.mitigation: Anchor aspirational copy with one present-day bottleneck and proof.

items.name: Proven Process
items.whenToUse: Use when buyers prioritize risk control, governance, and delivery confidence.
narrativeArc: Show decision gates and evidence at each stage.

hero.headline: A proven path from fragmented tooling to governed execution.
hero.subhead: Use a phased method to design, pilot, and operationalize internal execution capabilities.

items.risk: Process detail may feel heavy before value is clear.
items.mitigation: Lead with outcomes, then layer process in expandable sections.

items.name: Industry Insider
items.whenToUse: Use when a specific vertical has unique workflows, controls, or compliance needs.
narrativeArc: Translate capability model into that domain.

hero.headline: Execution models tuned for your operating environment.
hero.subhead: Apply one capability framework with language and controls matched to your industry.

items.risk: Over-segmentation can dilute the core brand story.
items.mitigation: Keep a shared core narrative and vary only context-specific examples.
